title: Could Macron set up a 'technocratic government' after the elections? A few lessons from the Italian experience
summary: As the second round of elections on Sunday, July 7, is set to usher in an unprecedented situation for the Fifth Republic, an atypical model of crisis resolution, used several times by our Italian neighbors, could be a source of inspiration.

title: The RN vote creeps into families: 'I was really ashamed, and he felt it'
summary: The far right's success has not only reshaped the French political landscape but also penetrated the intimacy of the home. Five families explain this swing, motivated by fear, disillusionment, exasperation and prejudice, which forces everyone to take a stand.

title: French elections: The last seat estimates before Sunday's second round
summary: With two days to go before the second round of France's parliamentary elections, the far-right Rassemblement National and its allies appear to be in the lead, but short of an absolute majority, according to the latest Ipsos Talan poll for Le Monde, Radio France and France Télévisions.

title: How the Rassemblement National found itself on the doorstep of power
summary: Marine Le Pen has been riding a wave of positive momentum for the past two years, which could give her far-right party a majority in the Assemblée Nationale just two years after a difficult presidential election.

title: French elections: 'Everywhere, always, the far right has ended up adding to the world's woes'
summary: Following the president's irresponsible decision to dissolve the Assemblée Nationale, it's now up to voters to prevent the Rassemblement National from coming to power in France, writes Le Monde's director, Jérôme Fenoglio, in his editorial.

title: 'The Bolsonaro experience in Brazil has shown that the victory of the far right is never trivial'
summary: At a time when the far-right Rassemblement National party could be victorious in France's parliamentary elections, Jair Bolsonaro's four years in power in Brazil have shown that 'testing' the far right is never trivial.

title: Euro 2024: Netherlands into semifinal against England after beating Turkey
summary: The Dutch struck two second-half goals in seven minutes to come from behind to beat Turkey 2-1 on Saturday and set up a Euro 2024 semi-final clash with England.

title: Burkina Faso, Niger and Mali sign 'confederation' treaty marking divorce from West Africa bloc
summary: The military leaders entered a new 'confederation' Saturday as they signed a treaty during their first summit in Niamey. The three countries in January said they were quitting the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), an organization they accused of being manipulated by France, their former colonial ruler.

title: Barcelona residents protest against mass tourism
summary: The city's rising cost of housing, up 68% in the past decade according to local authorities, is one of the main issues for the movement, along with the effects of tourism on local commerce and working conditions.

title: Slovakia undertakes purging of power within institutions
summary: Since his return to power in October 2023, nationalist Prime Minister Robert Fico has escalated efforts to dismiss employees deemed a problem within public media, the police and the judiciary. The assassination attempt against him in May has only bolstered his determination to bring these institutions into line.

title: Euro 2024: England beats Switzerland in a penalty shootout to reach semifinals
summary: England's quest for a first major tournament win in 58 years remained alive after another late fightback before beating Switzerland 5-3 on penalties to book their place in the semi-finals on Saturday. The English team goes on to play the Netherlands in Dortmund on Wednesday for a spot in the final.

title: UK's new PM Starmer scraps controversial Rwanda deportation plan
summary: The former government's controversial plan to deport asylum seekers from the UK to Rwanda, which had sparked legal challenges, is the first measure discontinued by newly-elected UK prime minister Keir Starmer.

title: Russia steps up pressure to block the transfer of F-16s to Ukraine
summary: With the arrival of the first Western fighter jets sent by Ukraine's allies having been announced for July, Russia has stepped up its strikes on Ukrainian air bases.

title: Joe Biden maintains his candidacy but fails to reassure Democrats
summary: Speaking on ABC, the US president shut down calls to withdraw from the race, considering himself as the 'most qualified' to beat Donald Trump. Yet since his failed debate, Democratic voices are increasingly urging him to step aside.

title: 'It's like living in an oven': Pakistan and India crushed by deadly heat waves
summary: Since May, a series of heat waves have swept across the northern part of the Indian subcontinent causing hundreds of deaths, particularly in large cities. The region's impoverished inhabitants are the first to suffer.

title: Dmitri Tcherniakov: 'There's nothing exceptional about the Atreides family, they're people of today'
summary: In an interview, the Russian theatre director, who opened the Festival d'Aix-en-Provence on July 3, explains how he conceived his diptych of Gluck operas around Iphigenia.

title: France-Portugal: Les Bleus overcome the trauma of penalty shootouts
summary: The French soccer team, which once again proved lackluster offensively, qualified for the Euro semi-finals after a perfectly controlled penalty shootout (0-0, 5 penalties to 3).

title: UK PM Keir Starmer's new government is characterized by social diversity
summary: Several important ministers hail from very modest families and were schooled in the public education system, breaking with prior Conservative governments, whose members were mostly educated in private schools.

title: French elections: How is the far right gaining votes from women?
summary: Election after election, the Rassemblement National is convincing more women, who had long been resistant to it. Defenders of women's rights are afraid that feminist achievements will be rolled back by the far-right party if it wins.

title: Brazil's Pantanal, a treasure trove of biodiversity, has already fallen prey to flames
summary: Thousands of fires have broken out since the beginning of the year in this important wetland area in west-central Brazil. NGOs and authorities fear that the dry season, which has only just begun, could lead to even bigger fires than in 2020.

title: Reformist candidate Masoud Pezeshkian wins Iran's presidential runoff election
summary: A vote count offered by authorities put Pezeshkian as the winner with 16.3 million votes to Jalili’s 13.5 million in Friday’s election. In Tehran, the reformist candidate gave a speech thanking his supporters, saying their votes have 'given hope to a society plunged into an atmosphere of dissatisfaction'.

title: Lunch in Paris? 15 (delicious) set menus from €20 to €30
summary: Smoked eel tacos or veggie mezze, fantastic pizzas or Korean dishes: Le Monde picked 15 places in Paris to enjoy a seasonal menu without breaking the bank.

title: French elections: Why the dichotomy between the so-called rural and urban vote is misleading
summary: Voting differences between urban and rural areas are first and foremost an effect of their social make-up, not a spatial distinction, according to several specialists, who warn that this idea plays into the far right's hands.

title: In Sweden, plans to allow alcohol to be sold at the producer's premises destabilize state monopoly
summary: A draft law presented by the government proposes to modify the state monopoly on alcohol sales. However, before it can be adopted, it will have to get the green light from Brussels.

title: Russian MPs at war with 'Satanism'
summary: Members of parliament have drawn up a list of people and organizations 'promoting terrorist, extremist and destructive ideologies,' including LGBT people, defenders of abortion rights, members of the Azov unit of the Ukrainian armed forces and Meta, the parent company of Facebook.

title: French elections: When will France get a new government? Five questions to understand what happens after vote
summary: The French elections on Sunday, July 7, are likely to result in a political configuration unseen before under the Fifth Republic. Here's what happens in the days after the vote.

title: Paris 2024: Animal welfare organizations demand that foie gras be removed from VIP guest menus
summary: Despite the Organizing Committee's commitment to encouraging plant-based foods during the Olympic Games − and to sourcing products that respect animal welfare − the catering offered during the event may include foie gras.

title: EU foreign policy chief issues fresh rebuke to Hungary's Orban
summary: The Hungarian Prime Minister, whose country took over the EU's rotating presidency this month, attended a meeting of the Organization of Turkic States in Azerbaijan on Saturday. 'Hungary has not received any mandate from the EU Council to advance the relations' with this organization, Josep Borrell said in a statement.

title: Israel grabs largest tract of West Bank land in three decades
summary: Over 1,200 hectares of Palestinian land have been declared 'state land' by Benjamin Netanyahu's government. This decision, taken in the context of the war in Gaza, is part of a policy of annexing territory of the West Bank.

title: Joe Biden clings on, drawing scrutiny
summary: Can Joe Biden maintain his bid for succession? Every outing by the American president, as here in Westhampton Beach, New York, on June 29, is scrutinized. From head to toe.

title: French elections: Second round turnout by noon highest in four decades
summary: 66.71% of French electors had turned out to vote for the first round of the country's parliamentary elections, on June 30. Today's vote will determine the extent of the far-right Rassemblement National party's historic rise.

title: Joe Biden dropped by major Hollywood donors
summary: More and more film industry figures, such as Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings, have called on the US president to pass the torch to another Democratic candidate in the race for the White House.

title: Legislative 2024: "I grew up in an environment where being gay wasn't a problem. But in Cologne as in Paris, that's changing."
summary: Le Monde spoke with people from across France about their personal hopes and fears in the run up to the second round of snap elections that could see the far right reach power. Today, Stephan Elles, a 33-year-old Franco-German, shares his experience

title: German population census reveals some surprises
summary: The results of the survey, which took place from May 2022 to January 2023, have sparked surprise. Almost 2 million homes are vacant across the country.

title: Google bets on African languages, including Dyula, Wolof, Baoulé and Tamazight
summary: The Silicon Valley giant's translator has integrated 31 languages from the continent, spoken by over 200 million people.

title: French elections: Second round turnout at highest in four decades
summary: 59.71% of French voters had turned out to vote by 5 pm, slightly more than in the first round, a week ago, when voters had already turned out in large numbers.

title: French elections: RN's disreputable candidates expose flaws in party's boasted readiness
summary: The far-right party claimed to be fully prepared for potential early elections, with a plan to conquer the prime minister's office. But dozens of candidates turned out to have racist, homophobic, anti-Semitic or xenophobic leanings.

title: How Macron is preparing for 'cohabitation' with the far right
summary: Even before the French cast their final votes in the elections, the president began planning in case he has to share power with the Rassemblement National. He is speeding up key appointments while he still has control of the government.

title: Why do we forget our earliest memories?
summary: The first years of life are generally inaccessible to our adult memory. Neuroscience explores this intriguing 'infantile amnesia,' revisiting a concept coined by Sigmund Freud.

title: The boom in male masturbation toys: 'I have friends who are afraid they'd prefer it to the real thing'
summary: Online, some men extol the benefits of male sex toys, and imagine lives without human partners in order to repair a masculinity they feel has atrophied.

title: In the European Parliament, a possible joint group with Marine Le Pen and Viktor Orban
summary: On Monday, Rassemblement National Members of the European Parliamanet (MEPs) could join the Hungarian prime minister's group Patriots for Europe.

title: French elections: Left projected to win most seats, ahead of Macron's coalition and far right
summary: According to initial estimates, the Nouveau Front Populaire left-wing alliance is projected to win between 172 and 192 seats in France's Assemblée Nationale, ahead of Macron's coalition (between 150 and 170) and the far-right Rassemblement National (between 132 and 152).

title: 2024 French election results: Chart and map of second-round winners
summary: French voters returned to the polls on Sunday, July 7, to elect a new Assemblée Nationale and determine who will be in a position to govern France. See how many seats each party won and the district-by-district map.

title: Tour de France: Frenchman Turgis wins stage 8 on gravel roads
summary: Anthony Turgis won after a long breakaway, while Tadej Pogacar attacked several times but couldn't get the better of Jonas Vingegaard and Remco Evenepoel.

title: French elections: Former president François Hollande elected to Parliament
summary: Hollande, who had been president when Macron emerged onto France's political scene, won a majority of votes cast in his constituency, running against both the far-right Rassemblement National candidate and incumbent right-wing MP Francis Dubois.

title: French election: Former prime minister Elisabeth Borne re-elected
summary: Borne, who saw through the controversial pension reform, was re-elected with 56.37% of the vote in her Normandy constituency, ahead of the far-right candidate.

title: French elections: Far right's rise blocked by 'republican front'
summary: The left is projected to win 172 to 192 seats, ahead of President Emmanuel Macron's coalition (150 to 170 seats) and the far-right Rassemblement National and its allies (132 to 152 seats), according to initial estimates.

title: French PM Attal offers to resign after Macron's coalition loses majority
summary: With no clear majority in the Assemblée Nationale, Gabriel Attal may stay in office while negotiations on forming a new government take place.

title: French elections: LFI dissenter François Ruffin narrowly re-elected
summary: Ruffin, who fell out with Jean-Luc Mélenchon and the La France Insoumise party during the campaign, was elected with 51.21% of the vote in a tough contest against the far right.

title: French elections: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin re-elected in stronghold
summary: Darmanin, who had said he intended to leave President Emmanuel Macron's government after the elections, announced having won in his northern French stronghold, beating the far-right Rassemblement National party candidate.

title: Controversial right-wing party leader Eric Ciotti announces his re-election in parliamentary elections
summary: Eric Ciotti, whose decision to ally with the far-right RN party led to his Les Républicain party tearing itself apart, announced his re-election on X, beating left-wing candidate Olivier Salerno and presidential coalition candidate Graig Monetti.

title: French elections: Marine Le Pen's sister beaten
summary: Marie-Caroline Le Pen, the sister of French far-right leader Marine Le Pen, was beaten by a left-wing candidate.
